physical_appearance:The image shows a digital print. It is rectangular in shape. The background of the digital print is blue in colour. The background of the photograph shows the structure of a flight of stairs in a zig-zag orientation. The flight of stairs has red railings. A construction worker is depicted to be ascending the flight of stairs. He adorns a yellow helmet and carries a red pail.

sgcool_label_text:This photograph was taken at National University Singapore by Singaporean photographer Tan Lip Seng. Tan is arguably the most important photographer in the region developing colour derivative and photo montage techniques. His works in the 1960s were a result of various experiments meticulously combining multiple colour transparencies into one to achieve the desired montage within one frame.\r\n\r\nTan Lip Seng also spent 42 years as a medical photographer at the National University of Singapore.

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This photograph was taken at National University Singapore by Singaporean photographer Tan Lip Seng. Tan is arguably the most important photographer in the region developing colour derivative and photo montage techniques. His works in the 1960s were a result of various experiments meticulously combining multiple colour transparencies into one to achieve the desired montage within one frame.

Tan Lip Seng also spent 42 years as a medical photographer at the National University of Singapore.
